newsitem.title: UK: TENNIS-DAY SIX SNIPPETS FROM WIMBLEDON.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-DAY SIX SNIPPETS FROM WIMBLEDON.

text.p: Day six snippets at Wimbledon on Saturday:

Quote of the day - "I don't have a tent, but I've brought my dress. I can't go on Centre Court in my sloppy trousers, can I?" Tennis fan Moira Dixon, preparing for a night on the pavement after the announcement of play on the Middle Sunday for only the second time in Wimbledon history.
Stat of the day - 46. The number of aces served by Goran Ivanisevic in his second round match with Swede Magnus Norman, eclipsing the previous record of 42 set by Britain's John Feaver.
Speed merchants - Greg Rusedski of Britain and Mark Philippoussis have recorded the fastest serves at Wimbledon so far. Both have been clocked at 138 miles per hour (222 kph)

Under wraps - Women's world number one Martina Hingis is learning quickly about certain British newspapers. After less than flattering pictures of her were printed earlier in the week, she wore a pair of shorts under her tennis dress during her second round win over Olga Barabanshchikova.
